jde.juci
Interface Connection

All Known Implementing Classes:
ConnectionImpl
public interface Connection

A Connection is the object that is registered in the Beanshell and represents a session for two-way communication between Emacs and Java code.

Version:
1.0
Author:
Nick Sieger

Method Summary
 void begin()
          Indicates the start of the connection's session.
 void end()
          Indicates the end of the connection's lifecycle.
 void evalBshScript(java.lang.String statement)
          Evaluate a Beanshell script statement over this connection, so that the script code can itself interact with JUCI to make calls back to Elisp.
 java.lang.Object peekResult()
          Examine, but don't remove, the value at the top of the connection's result stack.
 java.lang.Object popResult()
          Remove and return the value at the top of the connection's result stack.
 void pushResult(java.lang.Object result)
          Add a value to the top of the connection's result stack.
 void reset()
          Reset the connection, clearing the result stack.
 void setLoggerFilename(java.lang.String filename)
          Since standard output is used for communication between java code and Emacs, debug logging cannot be done there.
 

Method Detail

begin

void begin()
Indicates the start of the connection's session.

end

void end()
Indicates the end of the connection's lifecycle. Any remaining results on the connection's result stack are flushed as lisp forms for Emacs to evaluate.

reset

void reset()
Reset the connection, clearing the result stack. Normally used to clean up after an error.

pushResult

void pushResult(java.lang.Object result)
Add a value to the top of the connection's result stack.

Parameters:
result - a result to be exposed to the other side of the communication boundary

peekResult

java.lang.Object peekResult()
Examine, but don't remove, the value at the top of the connection's result stack.

Returns:
the result at the top of the stack
Throws:
NoMoreResultsException - if the result stack is empty

popResult

java.lang.Object popResult()
Remove and return the value at the top of the connection's result stack.

Returns:
the result at the top of the stack
Throws:
NoMoreResultsException - if the result stack is empty

setLoggerFilename

void setLoggerFilename(java.lang.String filename)
Since standard output is used for communication between java code and Emacs, debug logging cannot be done there. With this method, a filename for logging is set and logging is turned on for the connection.

Parameters:
filename - a log filename

evalBshScript

void evalBshScript(java.lang.String statement)
                   throws java.lang.Throwable
Evaluate a Beanshell script statement over this connection, so that the script code can itself interact with JUCI to make calls back to Elisp.

Parameters:
statement - a String value
Throws:
java.lang.Throwable
